dmca.title: [EV1-C2370403I] Complaint about 'thebirdman.org'
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the
Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your
claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/index.html?p=copyright.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.
-----Original Message-----
From: abuse@ev1servers.net [mailto:abuse@ev1servers.net] 
Sent: Tuesday, January 02, 2007 7:10 PM
To: DMCA
Subject: [EV1-C2370403I] Complaint about 'thebirdman.org'

==== Forwarded Ticket ====
1. Complaint about 'thebirdman.org'
Added by system at Saturday, Dec 30 2006 06:24 am

Message-ID: <000801c72c0d$2df338e0$95961052@your0objn0zbxq>
From: "Garry Vass" <infobb@yaelf.com>
To: <abuse@theplanet.com>
Subject: Complaint about 'thebirdman.org' 
Date: Sat, 30 Dec 2006 12:22:29 -0000
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: multipart/alternative; 
        boundary="----=_NextPart_000_0005_01C72C0D.2C8FFF60" 
X-Priority: 3
X-MSMail-Priority: Normal
X-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook Express 6.00.2900.3028
X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V6.00.2900.3028
X-OriginalArrivalTime: 30 Dec 2006 12:23:02.0184 (UTC)
FILETIME=[3FE9EA80:01C72C0D] 

 (multipart/alternative)
Multipart prefix (text/plain)
This is a multi-part message in MIME format. 
 
MIME element (text/plain)
Hello, 
 
I should like to complain and provide the correspondence trail below.
My complaint is against 'thebirdman.org'. 
 
As shown, a site hosted at THEPLANET and managed by an apparent John
Bryant has been running copyright material in its entirety which was
obtained from my site.  Upon my request to remove the material, John
Bryant replied with a demand for $25.   
 
This constitutes abuse, and I would be very grateful for your
intervention.  The original material is on my site at
http://www.yaelf.com/questions.shtml 
 
Thanks in advance,
Garry 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Return-Path: <jbryant@lzy.net>
Received: from aamtain07-winn.ispmail.ntl.com ([81.103.221.35]) 
          by mtain03-winn.ispmail.ntl.com with ESMTP 
          id
<20061230070234.JDQJ3153.mtain03-winn.ispmail.ntl.com@aamtain07-winn.isp
mail.ntl.com> 
          for <windingway@ntlworld.com>; Sat, 30 Dec 2006 07:02:35 +0000
Received: from fbr00.csee.siteprotect.com ([64.41.126.161]) 
          by aamtain07-winn.ispmail.ntl.com with ESMTP 
          id
<20061230070233.FHBW6017.aamtain07-winn.ispmail.ntl.com@fbr00.csee.sitep
rotect.com> 
          for <windingway@ntlworld.com>; Sat, 30 Dec 2006 07:02:33 +0000
Received: from localhost (unknown [64.41.122.5])  by
fbr00.csee.siteprotect.com (Postfix) with ESMTP id F322FFED95  for

neither permitted nor denied by domain of lzy.net)

(CST)

24E87179E05; Sat, 30 Dec 2006 07:02:24 +0000 (GMT)
Received: from lbryant (dialup-4.247.122.211.Dial1.Tampa1.Level3.net
[4.247.122.211])  by mail6.mdx.safepages.com (Postfix) with ESMTP id
C140A179C54  for <infobb@yaelf.com>; Sat, 30 Dec 2006 07:02:18 +0000
(GMT)
Message-ID: <200612300204400190.0062CAC2@mail.lzy.net>
In-Reply-To: <000601c72b93$9bd76540$95961052@your0objn0zbxq>
References: <000601c72b93$9bd76540$95961052@your0objn0zbxq>
X-Mailer: Calypso Version 3.30.00.00 (3)
Date: Sat, 30 Dec 2006 02:04:40 -0800
Reply-To: john@thebirdman.org
From: "John Bryant" <jbryant@lzy.net>
To: "Garry Vass" <infobb@yaelf.com>
Subject: Re: My content running at your site
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii" 
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
X-Spam-Status: No, hits=1.999 required=3 tests=[DATE_IN_FUTURE_03_06=2,
SPF_HELO_PASS=-0.001]
X-Spam-Level: * 
 
To those who have requested that I remove an article of theirs from my=
 website: 
 
I will be happy to do so for $25.00 PAYABLE IN ADVANCE.  The charge=
reimburses me for my valuable time, and for the unpleasant task of
doing=  something stupid (see below for explanation).  Address for
payment: John=  Bryant, PO Box 66683, St Pete Beach FL 33736-6683. 
 
Other comments: 
 
* You will get no benefit from my removing the article, whereas if the=
article stays, you will have something that would direct people to your=

 website or otherwise get you some attention.  Now you will have
nothing.   
 
* Honoring your request means I will have to take my good time to
satisfy=  your inflated ego because it is 'your' article.  I mean, why
don't you get= 
 out on the street and jump up and down and yell "Mine!  Mine!  Mine!"

 
* For your information, I prefer to link rather than post on my site --=
it's quicker (no loading) and I don't have to deal with
overly-possessive=  copyright holders like you.  But when people don't
send me a link, I can't=  do that (Most of the things I post are things
people send me, your article=  being one).  So, as in your case, I post
the article. 
 
* People like you who ask to have their articles removed are invariably=
filled with the notion that they have written something of IMMENSE=
importance.  But 99 and 44/100ths percent of the time, what they have=
written is of immense UNIMPORTANCE, and the fact that they are so=
possessive of it merely shows their judgement is right down there in
the=  toilet with their article. 
 
* You should be honored that you got posted.  My site is one of the
most=  popular on the web, and I can post only a small portion of what I
receive.= 
  But I don't hear any thank-yous.   
 
 
*********** REPLY SEPARATOR  *********** 
 
On 12/29/06 at 9:52 PM Garry Vass wrote: 
 
>Hi,
> 
>I run the Yaelf.com website and I refer to your page at 
>http://www.thebirdman.org/Index/Temp/Temp-SomeInterestingWordOrigins-Sc
>roll=
DownALittle-EH.htm 
> 
>Your content appears to have been lifted from my site.   
> 
>Perhaps you were not aware of this, but in all cases I would ask that 
>you implement corrective measures and replace your content with a link 
>to the original site.
> 
>Thanks in advance,
>Garry
